revised_title: The Effect of Felling Season on Oak Tree Alburnum Quality
tldr: Thomas Andrew Knight investigates the difference in qualities of alburnum from oak trees felled in spring and winter. He found that winter-felled alburnum has a lower specific gravity and gains less weight when exposed to damp conditions compared to spring-felled alburnum. Knight suggests that by removing bark in spring and felling the tree in winter, the timber's quality could be improved.
